title: Should Multiple Ranked Accounts Be Removed
body: Just put yes or no and explain why.

replies.body:
No, for one main reason
1) Riot wouldnt be able to RELIABLY detect multiple accounts. 
Lets say someone has a sister and they both play the champions at about a similar skill level on the same wifi/same computer. If riot removed ones ability to play ranked, that simply isnt fair.

> Lets say someone has a sister and they both play the champions at about a similar skill level on the same wifi/same computer. If riot removed ones ability to play ranked, that simply isnt fair.

First of all, the odds are slim that someone has a family member that:
Plays at the same ELO
Plays the same champions in the same roles
Plays at the same time of day
Itemizes the same
Uses chat the same way
And so on and so forth.

Secondly, if someone has family who plays in the same ELO and at the same time of day, they are GOING to queue up together, at least sometimes.
Win one match together and boom! Now the system knows they're not the same person.

Thirdly, reliablity is not crucial. Reducing smurfing is still good even if Riot can't eliminate it. Beware the Nirvana fallacy.

This whole post is if they should should they do it.
No, because it is not possible and would just be a nuisance to families with multiple players.

I'd say no, purely because they removed positional matchmaking. I only play one role. If I want to play another role and not get 9 reports for inting, I'd have to make another account, and removing an account purely off whether that account plays ranked is not right.

There's no problem with it. If a player wants to prove that they didn't just get lucky to climb, fine. While it could be said that those players ruin the game for the lower ranked players that try to play with others at their skill, 1: It's one game, and 2: They don't want to be there either. They want to climb out. Now I definitely think the same person shouldn't be able to hold multiple places in a limited-players rank like Challenger, but they should still be able to rank up other accounts to prove to themselves that they are the legend they think they are.

Personally id say yes. Its really hard to recommend a friend to come play this game knowing their is none stop smurfs and they would get flamed on for being bad, and completely dominated on. There really isn't a new player base anymore and most of my friends that did get to join played a few games then never came back due to how out classed they was and the hate they received. 

Also i would like to point out most people with Alt accounts dont care about punishments received and is over looked. If a Alt got banned or perma banned i doubt anyone would care, they would just move to their main account. Thus the amount of toxic players in lower levels is extremely high!

How can riot really tackle this problem, i'm not entirerly sure except maybe putting a paywall behind it or possibly a phone number or some other restriction or verification other then an email because those can be used over and over again. I like the phone number idea just limit the number of accounts attached to it.

Playing on a old account can hold you back from actually climbing.

Something should be done about people with 30-45% wr being allowed to play the game.
